translated: Jātaka
Pañcakanipāta
Maṇikuṇḍalavagga
Koraṇḍiya Jātaka

analyzed: ekaḥ araññe giri kandarāya  paggayha paggayha silam pavecchasi
translated: Alone in the forest, in a mountain cave,🔽You throw down the rock, again and again,
As if you were crossing over and over again.
Koraṇḍiya, what is your purpose?
I will make this ocean-girt earth
Even like the palm of my hand.
I will destroy the hills and mountains,
So I throw down the rock.
This earth is not fit to be made even
By a man alone.
I think you are just trying to destroy the earth,
Koraṇḍiya, you laugh at the world of the living.

analyzed: sace aham bhūta dharam na sakkā
translated: If I cannot make this earth even
By a man alone,

analyzed: evam eva tvam brahme ime manusse
translated: Then in the same way, O Brahmā,

analyzed: nānādiṭṭhike nānayissasi te  saṅkhitta rūpena bhavam mamattha
translated: You will not lead these people with different views.🔽In brief, sir, you have told me your purpose.
Koraṇḍiya, it is just as you say.
Just as the earth cannot be made even
By a man, so too are men.
The Koraṇḍiya Jātaka.
